required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating CMC-544 In B-Cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study Of Cmc-544 Administered As A Single Agent In Subjects With B-cell Non- Hodgkin's Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD), the tolerability, and the initial safety profile of CMC-544 in subjects with B-cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma (NHL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 42 days after last dose of study drug (up to Day 225)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAE) are defined as any new event reported after first dose of study drug up to 42 days after last dose of study drug, or any event that is worse in severity than at any time during the baseline period. AEs included both SAEs and non-serious adverse events (non-SAEs).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 3 or Higher Grades Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) Based on Severity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 42 days after last dose of study drug (up to Day 225)
primary_outcome.description: AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. AE severity was defined to be the maximum toxicity grade of the treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) experienced by the participants during the study. AE was assessed according to severity; Grade 1 (mild AE), Grade 2 (moderate AE), Grade 3 (severe AE), Grade 4 (life-threatening or disabling AE), Grade 5 (death related to AE). Participants with Grade 3 or higher grades TEAEs were reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD): Part 1 (Dose Escalation Cohorts)
primary_outcome.description: MTD was defined as highest dose level for which no more than 1 participant in a dose cohort experienced dose limiting toxicity (DLT). DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the first 21 days (or 28 days for participants treated every 4 weeks) days of study medication and considered at least possibly-related to study medication: any grade 3 or 4 non-hematologic toxicity except grade 3 alopecia, nausea, or vomiting, any grade 4 febrile neutropenia, any grade 4 thrombocytopenia or any bleeding episode requiring platelet transfusion, any grade 4 absolute neutrophil count (for a duration of greater than or equal to [>=] 7 days), delayed recovery (less than or equal to [<=] grade 1 or baseline) from a toxicity that delays the initiation of the next dose by more than 2 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Dose-limiting Toxicity (DLT)
primary_outcome.description: DLT was classified as per National Cancer Institute common terminology criteria for adverse events (NCI CTCAE) version 3.0 and defined as any of the following events occurring during the first 21 days (or 28 days for participants treated every 4 weeks) days of study medication and considered at least possibly-related to study medication: any grade 3 or 4 non-hematologic toxicity except grade 3 alopecia, nausea, or vomiting, any grade 4 febrile neutropenia, any grade 4 thrombocytopenia or any bleeding episode requiring platelet transfusion, any grade 4 absolute neutrophil count (for a duration of greater than or equal to [>=] 7 days), delayed recovery (less than or equal to [<=] grade 1 or baseline) from a toxicity that delays the initiation of the next dose by more than 14 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-Free Survival (PFS): Evaluable Population- Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 8 weeks up to Year 1, then every 12 weeks up to Year 2, and then every 6 months until tumor progression or death (up to Year 5)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was based on Kaplan-Meier estimates. PFS was defined as the time interval from the first dose of study medication until the first date on which relapsed disease, or progression (as per the International Response Criteria for Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma) or death, was documented, censored at the last tumor evaluation date. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-Free Survival (PFS): Intent-to-treat Population-Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 8 weeks up to Year 1, then every 12 weeks up to Year 2, and then every 6 months until tumor progression or death (up to Year 5)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was based on Kaplan-Meier estimates. PFS was defined as the time interval from the first dose of study medication until the first date on which relapsed disease, or progression (as per International Response Criteria for Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma) or death, was documented, censored at the last tumor evaluation date. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS): Evaluable Population- Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
secondary_outcome.description: OS was based on Kaplan-Meier method. Survival was defined as the time period from the first dose of study drug until the date of death, censored at the participant's last contact date. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS): Intent-to-treat Population: Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
secondary_outcome.description: Interval OS was based on Kaplan-Meier method. Survival was defined as the time period from the first dose of study drug until the date of death, censored at the participant's last contact date. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Best Overall Response (BOR): Part 2 (Expanded Cohorts)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 8 weeks up to Year 1, then every 12 weeks up to Year 2, and then every 6 months until tumor progression or death (up to Year 5)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with BOR=with complete response(CR),unconfirmed CR(CRu) or partial response (PR) as per International Response Criteria for NHL. CR: Total disappearance of all detectable clinical,radiographic sign of disease/related symptoms,normalization biochemical abnormalities related to NHL;if enlarged before therapy all lymph nodes,nodal masses,other organs regressed to normal size and spleen regressed in size,undetectable on physical exam,clear bone marrow infiltrate. CRu: CR but allows for residual lymph node mass >1.5 cm in greatest transverse diameter and all individual nodes previously merged were regressed by >75% in product diameters and indeterminate bone marrow. PR:>=50% decrease in sum of products of greatest diameters(SPD) of 6 largest dominant nodes/nodal masses,no increase in size of other nodes/spleen/liver, 50% decrease in SPD of splenic,hepatic nodules,involvement of other organs considered assessable,not measurable disease with exception of splenic,hepatic nodules.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Overall Response (DoR): Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 8 weeks up to Year 1, then every 12 weeks up to Year 2, and then every 6 months until tumor progression or death (up to Year 5)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of overall response was defined as the time from the date that measurement criteria were met for CR, CRu, or PR (whichever status was recorded first) until the first date that relapsed disease was objectively documented as per International Response Criteria for NHL, taking as reference for relapsed disease the smallest measurements recorded since the treatment started. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 8 weeks up to Year 1, then every 12 weeks up to Year 2, and then every 6 months until tumor progression or death (up to Year 5)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to tumor progression was defined as the interval from the start of the treatment until the first date on which relapsed disease or progression is documented, censored at the last disease assessment. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response- Evaluable Population: Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 42 days after last dose (Day 225)
other_outcome.description: Participants (having follicular or diffuse lymphoma) with objective response based assessment of CR, CRu or PR as per International Response Criteria for NHL. CR: Total disappearance of all detectable clinical, radiographic sign of disease/related symptoms, normalization biochemical abnormalities related to NHL; if enlarged before therapy all lymph nodes, nodal masses, other organs regressed to normal size and spleen regressed in size, undetectable on physical exam, clear bone marrow infiltrate. CRu: CR but allows for residual lymph node mass >1.5 cm in greatest transverse diameter and all individual nodes previously merged were regressed by >75% in product diameters and indeterminate bone marrow. PR: >=50% decrease in SPD of 6 largest dominant nodes or nodal masses, no increase in size of other nodes, spleen or liver, 50% decrease in SPD of splenic, hepatic nodules, involvement of other organs considered assessable, not measurable disease with exception of splenic, hepatic nodules.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response- Intent-to-treat Population: Part 2 (Lead in+ Expanded Cohorts)
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 42 days after last dose of study drug (Day 225)
other_outcome.description: Participants (having follicular or diffuse lymphoma) with objective response based assessment of CR, CRu or PR as per International Response Criteria for NHL. CR: Total disappearance of all detectable clinical, radiographic sign of disease/related symptoms, normalization biochemical abnormalities related to NHL; if enlarged before therapy all lymph nodes, nodal masses, other organs regressed to normal size and spleen regressed in size, undetectable on physical exam, clear bone marrow infiltrate. CRu: CR but allows for residual lymph node mass >1.5 cm in greatest transverse diameter and all individual nodes previously merged were regressed by >75% in product diameters and indeterminate bone marrow. PR: >=50% decrease in SPD of 6 largest dominant nodes or nodal masses, no increase in size of other nodes, spleen or liver, 50% decrease in SPD of splenic, hepatic nodules, involvement of other organs considered assessable, not measurable disease with exception of splenic, hepatic nodules.

arm_group.description: Inotuzumab ozogamicin, iv, dose escalation and expanded cohort at 1.8mg/m2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have been previously diagnosed with CD22-positive, B-cell NHL, according to WHO classification, which has progressed after at least 2 prior therapies of probable clinical benefit
- At the expanded cohort, part 2 of the study, subjects must have one of the following:
- Follicular lymphoma previously treated with at least one dose of rituximab, but have not received radioimmunotherapy
- Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma
- Age 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Candidate for potentially curative therapies in the opinion of the investigator
- Chronic lymphocytic leukemia
- Burkitt's lymphoma, primary effusion lymphoma, and precursor B-cell lymphoblastic lymphoma

facility.name: University of Alabama at Birmingham Kirklin Clinic
Medizinische Klinik und Poliklinik III, Klinikum der Universitat Muenchen-Grosshadern
Hospital de la Santa Creu I Sant Pau

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The study was conducted in 2 parts. Part 1: Dose escalation cohorts of inotuzumab ozogamicin to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) included 21 days and 28 days dose administration cycles. Part 2: Expanded cohort using the MTD regimen identified in Part 1.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 0.4 mg/m^2: Dose Escalation Cohort 1
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) received 0.4 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) intravenous (IV) dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles unless there was an evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 21 days.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 0.8 mg/m^2: Dose Escalation Cohort 2
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 0.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was an evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 21 days.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.34 mg/m^2: Dose Escalation Cohort 3
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.34 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 21 days.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.8 mg/m^2: Dose Escalation Cohort 4
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 21 days.

group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 2.4 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 21 days.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.8 mg/m^2: Lead-in Cohort
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 28 days.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.8 mg/m^2: Expanded Cohort
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 28 days.

baseline.population: Baseline population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAE) are defined as any new event reported after first dose of study drug up to 42 days after last dose of study drug, or any event that is worse in severity than at any time during the baseline period. AEs included both SAEs and non-serious adverse events (non-SAEs).

outcome.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD): Part 1 (Dose Escalation Cohorts)
outcome.description: MTD was defined as highest dose level for which no more than 1 participant in a dose cohort experienced dose limiting toxicity (DLT). DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the first 21 days (or 28 days for participants treated every 4 weeks) days of study medication and considered at least possibly-related to study medication: any grade 3 or 4 non-hematologic toxicity except grade 3 alopecia, nausea, or vomiting, any grade 4 febrile neutropenia, any grade 4 thrombocytopenia or any bleeding episode requiring platelet transfusion, any grade 4 absolute neutrophil count (for a duration of greater than or equal to [>=] 7 days), delayed recovery (less than or equal to [<=] grade 1 or baseline) from a toxicity that delays the initiation of the next dose by more than 2 weeks.
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 2 of the study.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin: Dose Escalation Cohorts 1 to 5
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received either 0.4, 0.8, 1.34, 1.8 or 2.4 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles unless there was an evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 21 days.

measure.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD): Part 1 (Dose Escalation Cohorts)
measure.description: MTD was defined as highest dose level for which no more than 1 participant in a dose cohort experienced dose limiting toxicity (DLT). DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the first 21 days (or 28 days for participants treated every 4 weeks) days of study medication and considered at least possibly-related to study medication: any grade 3 or 4 non-hematologic toxicity except grade 3 alopecia, nausea, or vomiting, any grade 4 febrile neutropenia, any grade 4 thrombocytopenia or any bleeding episode requiring platelet transfusion, any grade 4 absolute neutrophil count (for a duration of greater than or equal to [>=] 7 days), delayed recovery (less than or equal to [<=] grade 1 or baseline) from a toxicity that delays the initiation of the next dose by more than 2 weeks.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Dose-limiting Toxicity (DLT)
outcome.description: DLT was classified as per National Cancer Institute common terminology criteria for adverse events (NCI CTCAE) version 3.0 and defined as any of the following events occurring during the first 21 days (or 28 days for participants treated every 4 weeks) days of study medication and considered at least possibly-related to study medication: any grade 3 or 4 non-hematologic toxicity except grade 3 alopecia, nausea, or vomiting, any grade 4 febrile neutropenia, any grade 4 thrombocytopenia or any bleeding episode requiring platelet transfusion, any grade 4 absolute neutrophil count (for a duration of greater than or equal to [>=] 7 days), delayed recovery (less than or equal to [<=] grade 1 or baseline) from a toxicity that delays the initiation of the next dose by more than 14 days.
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin. Here number of participant analyzed (N) signifies participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Dose-limiting Toxicity (DLT)
measure.description: DLT was classified as per National Cancer Institute common terminology criteria for adverse events (NCI CTCAE) version 3.0 and defined as any of the following events occurring during the first 21 days (or 28 days for participants treated every 4 weeks) days of study medication and considered at least possibly-related to study medication: any grade 3 or 4 non-hematologic toxicity except grade 3 alopecia, nausea, or vomiting, any grade 4 febrile neutropenia, any grade 4 thrombocytopenia or any bleeding episode requiring platelet transfusion, any grade 4 absolute neutrophil count (for a duration of greater than or equal to [>=] 7 days), delayed recovery (less than or equal to [<=] grade 1 or baseline) from a toxicity that delays the initiation of the next dose by more than 14 days.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS): Evaluable Population- Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
outcome.description: PFS was based on Kaplan-Meier estimates. PFS was defined as the time interval from the first dose of study medication until the first date on which relapsed disease, or progression (as per the International Response Criteria for Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma) or death, was documented, censored at the last tumor evaluation date. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 8 weeks up to Year 1, then every 12 weeks up to Year 2, and then every 6 months until tumor progression or death (up to Year 5)
outcome.population: Evaluable population: All participants who received at least 2 doses of study drug, had baseline tumor computed tomography (CT) scan, and at least 1 post-baseline tumor assessment for anti-cancer clinical activity. Here 'N' represents number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of study.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.8 mg/m^2: Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 28 days.

PFS was defined as the time interval from the first dose of study medication until the first date on which relapsed disease, or progression (as per the International Response Criteria for Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma) or death, was documented, censored at the last tumor evaluation date. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
measure.population: Evaluable population: All participants who received at least 2 doses of study drug, had baseline tumor computed tomography (CT) scan, and at least 1 post-baseline tumor assessment for anti-cancer clinical activity. Here 'N' represents number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of study.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS): Intent-to-treat Population-Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)

This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 8 weeks up to Year 1, then every 12 weeks up to Year 2, and then every 6 months until tumor progression or death (up to Year 5)
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all enrolled participants. Here 'N' represents number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of the study.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.8 mg/m^2: Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 28 days.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS): Intent-to-treat Population-Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
measure.description: PFS was based on Kaplan-Meier estimates. PFS was defined as the time interval from the first dose of study medication until the first date on which relapsed disease, or progression (as per International Response Criteria for Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma) or death, was documented, censored at the last tumor evaluation date. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all enrolled participants. Here 'N' represents number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of the study.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS): Evaluable Population- Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
outcome.description: OS was based on Kaplan-Meier method. Survival was defined as the time period from the first dose of study drug until the date of death, censored at the participant's last contact date. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
outcome.population: Evaluable population: All participants who received at least 2 doses of study drug, had baseline tumor CT scan, and at least 1 post-baseline tumor assessment for anti-cancer clinical activity. Here 'N' represents number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of study.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.8 mg/m^2: Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 28 days.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS): Evaluable Population- Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
measure.description: OS was based on Kaplan-Meier method. Survival was defined as the time period from the first dose of study drug until the date of death, censored at the participant's last contact date. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
measure.population: Evaluable population: All participants who received at least 2 doses of study drug, had baseline tumor CT scan, and at least 1 post-baseline tumor assessment for anti-cancer clinical activity. Here 'N' represents number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of study.

measurement_list.measurement: Data not collected since median overall survival was not reached for the participants with follicular lymphoma.

This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
outcome.population: ITT population included all enrolled participants. Here ‚ÄòN‚Äô signifies number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of the study.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.8 mg/m^2: Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 28 days.

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS): Intent-to-treat Population: Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
measure.description: Interval OS was based on Kaplan-Meier method. Survival was defined as the time period from the first dose of study drug until the date of death, censored at the participant's last contact date. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
measure.population: ITT population included all enrolled participants. Here ‚ÄòN‚Äô signifies number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of the study.

measurement_list.measurement: Data not collected since upper limit for overall survival was not reached for participants with follicular lymphoma.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Best Overall Response (BOR): Part 2 (Expanded Cohorts)
outcome.description: Participants with BOR=with complete response(CR),unconfirmed CR(CRu) or partial response (PR) as per International Response Criteria for NHL. CR: Total disappearance of all detectable clinical,radiographic sign of disease/related symptoms,normalization biochemical abnormalities related to NHL;if enlarged before therapy all lymph nodes,nodal masses,other organs regressed to normal size and spleen regressed in size,undetectable on physical exam,clear bone marrow infiltrate. CRu: CR but allows for residual lymph node mass >1.5 cm in greatest transverse diameter and all individual nodes previously merged were regressed by >75% in product diameters and indeterminate bone marrow. PR:>=50% decrease in sum of products of greatest diameters(SPD) of 6 largest dominant nodes/nodal masses,no increase in size of other nodes/spleen/liver, 50% decrease in SPD of splenic,hepatic nodules,involvement of other organs considered assessable,not measurable disease with exception of splenic,hepatic nodules.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 8 weeks up to Year 1, then every 12 weeks up to Year 2, and then every 6 months until tumor progression or death (up to Year 5)
outcome.population: Evaluable population was analyzed. Participants with diffuse or follicular lymphoma were analyzed. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 and Part 2 (Lead-in Cohort).

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.8 mg/m^2: Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 28 days.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Best Overall Response (BOR): Part 2 (Expanded Cohorts)
measure.description: Participants with BOR=with complete response(CR),unconfirmed CR(CRu) or partial response (PR) as per International Response Criteria for NHL. CR: Total disappearance of all detectable clinical,radiographic sign of disease/related symptoms,normalization biochemical abnormalities related to NHL;if enlarged before therapy all lymph nodes,nodal masses,other organs regressed to normal size and spleen regressed in size,undetectable on physical exam,clear bone marrow infiltrate. CRu: CR but allows for residual lymph node mass >1.5 cm in greatest transverse diameter and all individual nodes previously merged were regressed by >75% in product diameters and indeterminate bone marrow. PR:>=50% decrease in sum of products of greatest diameters(SPD) of 6 largest dominant nodes/nodal masses,no increase in size of other nodes/spleen/liver, 50% decrease in SPD of splenic,hepatic nodules,involvement of other organs considered assessable,not measurable disease with exception of splenic,hepatic nodules.
measure.population: Evaluable population was analyzed. Participants with diffuse or follicular lymphoma were analyzed. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 and Part 2 (Lead-in Cohort).

outcome.title: Duration of Overall Response (DoR): Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
outcome.description: Duration of overall response was defined as the time from the date that measurement criteria were met for CR, CRu, or PR (whichever status was recorded first) until the first date that relapsed disease was objectively documented as per International Response Criteria for NHL, taking as reference for relapsed disease the smallest measurements recorded since the treatment started. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 8 weeks up to Year 1, then every 12 weeks up to Year 2, and then every 6 months until tumor progression or death (up to Year 5)
outcome.population: Evaluable population was analyzed. DoR included evaluable participants who achieved CR, CRu, or PR. Here ‚ÄòN‚Äô signifies number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of the study.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.8 mg/m^2: Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 28 days.

measure.title: Duration of Overall Response (DoR): Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
measure.description: Duration of overall response was defined as the time from the date that measurement criteria were met for CR, CRu, or PR (whichever status was recorded first) until the first date that relapsed disease was objectively documented as per International Response Criteria for NHL, taking as reference for relapsed disease the smallest measurements recorded since the treatment started. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
measure.population: Evaluable population was analyzed. DoR included evaluable participants who achieved CR, CRu, or PR. Here ‚ÄòN‚Äô signifies number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of the study.

outcome.title: Time-to-Tumor Progression: Part 2 (Expanded Cohorts)
outcome.description: Time to tumor progression was defined as the interval from the start of the treatment until the first date on which relapsed disease or progression is documented, censored at the last disease assessment. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 8 weeks up to Year 1, then every 12 weeks up to Year 2, and then every 6 months until tumor progression or death (up to Year 5)
outcome.population: Evaluable population was analyzed. Here "N" signifies number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 and Part 2 (Lead-in Cohort) of the study.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.8 mg/m^2: Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 28 days.

measure.title: Time-to-Tumor Progression: Part 2 (Expanded Cohorts)
measure.description: Time to tumor progression was defined as the interval from the start of the treatment until the first date on which relapsed disease or progression is documented, censored at the last disease assessment. This outcome measure was analyzed in participants with follicular lymphoma or diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
measure.population: Evaluable population was analyzed. Here "N" signifies number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 and Part 2 (Lead-in Cohort) of the study.

Data not collected since upper limit for time to tumor progression was not reached.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response- Evaluable Population: Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
outcome.description: Participants (having follicular or diffuse lymphoma) with objective response based assessment of CR, CRu or PR as per International Response Criteria for NHL. CR: Total disappearance of all detectable clinical, radiographic sign of disease/related symptoms, normalization biochemical abnormalities related to NHL; if enlarged before therapy all lymph nodes, nodal masses, other organs regressed to normal size and spleen regressed in size, undetectable on physical exam, clear bone marrow infiltrate. CRu: CR but allows for residual lymph node mass >1.5 cm in greatest transverse diameter and all individual nodes previously merged were regressed by >75% in product diameters and indeterminate bone marrow. PR: >=50% decrease in SPD of 6 largest dominant nodes or nodal masses, no increase in size of other nodes, spleen or liver, 50% decrease in SPD of splenic, hepatic nodules, involvement of other organs considered assessable, not measurable disease with exception of splenic, hepatic nodules.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 42 days after last dose (Day 225)
outcome.population: Evaluable population: All participants who received at least 2 doses of study drug, had baseline tumor CT scan, and at least 1 post-baseline tumor assessment for anti-cancer clinical activity. Here 'N' represents number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of study.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 1.8 mg/m^2: Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell NHL received 1.8 mg/m^2 IV dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles, unless there was evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 28 days.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response- Evaluable Population: Part 2 (Lead-in + Expanded Cohorts)
measure.description: Participants (having follicular or diffuse lymphoma) with objective response based assessment of CR, CRu or PR as per International Response Criteria for NHL. CR: Total disappearance of all detectable clinical, radiographic sign of disease/related symptoms, normalization biochemical abnormalities related to NHL; if enlarged before therapy all lymph nodes, nodal masses, other organs regressed to normal size and spleen regressed in size, undetectable on physical exam, clear bone marrow infiltrate. CRu: CR but allows for residual lymph node mass >1.5 cm in greatest transverse diameter and all individual nodes previously merged were regressed by >75% in product diameters and indeterminate bone marrow. PR: >=50% decrease in SPD of 6 largest dominant nodes or nodal masses, no increase in size of other nodes, spleen or liver, 50% decrease in SPD of splenic, hepatic nodules, involvement of other organs considered assessable, not measurable disease with exception of splenic, hepatic nodules.
measure.population: Evaluable population: All participants who received at least 2 doses of study drug, had baseline tumor CT scan, and at least 1 post-baseline tumor assessment for anti-cancer clinical activity. Here 'N' represents number of participants evaluable for this outcome measure. This outcome measure was not planned to be analyzed in Part 1 of study.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response- Intent-to-treat Population: Part 2 (Lead in+ Expanded Cohorts)
measure.description: Participants (having follicular or diffuse lymphoma) with objective response based assessment of CR, CRu or PR as per International Response Criteria for NHL. CR: Total disappearance of all detectable clinical, radiographic sign of disease/related symptoms, normalization biochemical abnormalities related to NHL; if enlarged before therapy all lymph nodes, nodal masses, other organs regressed to normal size and spleen regressed in size, undetectable on physical exam, clear bone marrow infiltrate. reported_events.time_frame: Treatment-emergent events: Baseline up to 42 days after last dose of study drug (up to Day 225)
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as non-serious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and non-serious event during the study.

group.title: Inotuzumab Ozogamicin 0.4 mg/m^2: Dose Escalation Cohort 1
group.description: Participants with CD22-positive B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) received 0.4 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) intravenous (IV) dose of inotuzumab ozogamicin on Day 1 of each cycle, for at least 4 cycles unless there was an evidence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Each cycle was of 21 days.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
